Deficiency Narrative: The bathroom was observed with nothing for the children to use to dry their hands.
The medication record does not match the count of the pills.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email indicating that in an effort to make sure the medication administration remains in compliance, they have minimized distractions during the medication distribution and signage of the medication log also ensure that medication error logs are quickly in place if needed.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple service plans were not signed or dated by the children in care.
Correction Narrative: Agency provided a scanned copy of the signed service plan.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing the orientation given to the child upon admission, the education programs the facility provides was not found in handbook.
Correction Narrative: Agency added educational programs to the childrens orientation

Deficiency Narrative: PLSP signature or dates were not found in multiple service plans.
Correction Narrative: Agency provided a signed copy of the service plan.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing medication logs, multiple medication logs were observed to not have the reason for medication being prescribed.
Correction Narrative: "As result of deficiency 748.2151(c)(8) Medication record-must include reasons for administering psychotropic medication or non-prescription medication/supplement for a child under 5 years (Weight: Medium High). As an effort to make sure this does not take place again, we have highlighted the purpose section on the medication form so that this information is not missed moving forward and the nurse has been notified to double check her work before the sheets are printed out to be put in the medication log binder. "

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver stated that they "dozed off" during a time that they were in charge of supervising children.
Correction Narrative: Owner began to schedule 2 staff members at all times during the night, mentioned via phone call. Via email, owner mentioned that specifically when the worker involved in the investigation is to be scheduled, there would be additional staffing.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing the policies and procedures, this policy was not created.
Correction Narrative: Agency sent as policy: "Right At Home Care Inc. will not accept a child into our program who is pregnant.  If a child becomes pregnant then Right At Home Care Inc. will give a 14 day notice to discharge the child.  The Childs case worker will be notified immediately as soon as Right At Home Care Inc. is aware of the pregnancy.  Right At Home Care Inc. will make accommodations for the child to ensure the safety of the child and her unborn baby.  The nurse will make all necessary medical appointments that are needed while the child is still in Right At Home Care Inc.s care.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care did not receive a suicide screening every thirty days.
Correction Narrative: The operation provide suicide screenings for all active residents. Additionally, the operation stated, "The suicide screenings are now on the calendar and will alarm when its time to get them done before the 30 day expires." No concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the monthly menu did not list the snacks provided by the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted an updated menu that listed snacks provided by the operation, as well as meal alternatives. No concerns

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, an admission assessment, a preliminary service plan, and the facilities evacuation route contained inaccurate information.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted an updated admission's assessment form that accurate information.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children's prescribed medication did not have an accurate count of medication.
Correction Narrative: The operation completed med error sheets to accurately reflect the count. Additionally, the operation created a plan to ensure accurate counts are maintained: "For the medication everything is being counted daily prior to administering even those that are in the bottle. Comparing the medication in the blister packs to the medication log to ensure that the numbers are accurate as well as counting the pills in the bottle."

Deficiency Narrative: Admission Assessments did not include children's home environments and family function, the children's birth and neonatal history, and the child's social history.
Correction Narrative: Compliance was met upon the agency sending an email containing the updated admissions assessment that contained the missing items.
